question: Can I afford a monthly mortgage payment of $1,200 with an annual income of $75,000?
true_answer: Yes, with an annual income of $75,000, a monthly payment of $1,200 is affordable with a DTI of 28% and sufficient savings.

steps.content: Can I afford a monthly mortgage payment of $1,200 with an annual income of $75,000?
Plan: 1) Calculate debt-to-income ratio using income and mortgage payment. 2) Check minimum savings requirements. 3) Review with supervisor. 4) Provide final answer.
Calculating debt-to-income ratio with monthly payment of $1,200.
Calculated DTI is 28%, which is below the typical maximum of 36%.
Do I have enough savings for the upfront costs?
Retrieving knowledge on upfront savings requirements.
Upfront savings typically need to cover 20% down payment and 3-5% closing costs.
Assuming you have savings for these costs, verified with retrieved criteria.
Retrieving information on interest rate impacts.
Interest rate increases could raise your DTI; consider a fixed rate for stability.
Review complete, all criteria met for affordability.
Yes, with an annual income of $75,000, a monthly payment of $1,200 is affordable with a DTI of 28% and sufficient savings.
